intro: Gochnatia argentina, commonly known as the Argentine gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Gochnatia argentina is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
